channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Soccer Aid 2020: ITV apologise for revealing WRONG total raised
item.description: ITV have issued an apology after revealing the wrong total raised by Soccer Aid 2020 as they reveal charity match raised £2million less than announced due following an 'administrative error'

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's 'Lolita Express' plane lies abandoned in Georgia
item.description: Once the height of luxury, Jeffrey Epstein's Lolita Express now sits mothballed beside a Georgia runway racking up thousands of dollars in storage fees.

item.title: Charlie Hebdo cartoonist recalls the day her colleagues were killed
item.description: Corinne Rey, 38, had tears in her eyes but her voice was clear as she gave evidence at the trial of 13 men and one woman accused of helping three men plot the attacks on January 7-9 2015 in Paris.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK sees 'first credible' cases of REINFECTED people
item.description: Matt Hancock told the Health and Social Care Committee that the first 'credible' cases of coronavirus reinfection in Britain were starting to be seen.

item.title: Paramedic shares video after patient SPAT on her in lockdown assault
item.description: Paramedic Tracy Higginbottom was spat on while taking a young woman to hospital in an ambulance during a night shift in North Cornwall.
item.media:credit: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

item.title: BBC hold 'avoiding racial bias' training session with on-air talent ahead of the new football season
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY KIERAN GILL: Those tuning in to the webinar were also warned about how describing black players as having 'pace' or 'power' could see them fall into 'the trap of racial stereotyping'.

item.title: Jeff Bezos tops Forbes' list of richest Americans for the third year in a row
item.description: The aggregate wealth of the Forbes 400 list, released on Tuesday, rose to a record $3.2 trillion, as the richest Americans continued to do well even though the pandemic has devastated the economy.

item.title: The Queen, 94, plans to return to work at Buckingham Palace in October
item.description: The Queen and Duke of Edinburgh will spend time privately at Sandringham when they leave Balmoral next week, Buckingham Palace announced today.

item.title: Manchester Arena bombing: Chilling 999 call heard by public inquiry
item.description: Ronald Blake was trying to help stricken John Atkinson, 28, who had been caught in the blast carried out by suicide bomber Salman Abedi in the City Rooms, the foyer of the Manchester Arena.

item.title: Parents of schoolboy, 15, who was shot in face 'fought to save their seriously injured son'
item.description: A teenager was arrested two hours after a year 11 pupil, 15, was shot in the jaw at close range on his way to Kesgrave High School with what witnesses have described as 'a long bore rifle'.

item.title: Sports psychologist, 37, is jailed for life after bludgeoning his mother to death with a hammer
item.description: Robert Child, 37,struck his 64-year-old mother Janice with a hammer 31 times in a 'merciless attack' at her home in Woolton, Liverpool, on March 5, Liverpool Crown Court heard on Tuesday.

item.title: Caster Semenya loses Swiss Court appeal over restriction of testosterone levels in female athletes
item.description: The ruling means Semenya cannot defend her Olympic 800-meter title at the Tokyo Games next year, or compete at any top meets in distances from 400 meters to the mile.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bolton pubs ordered BACK into lockdown
item.description: Boris Johnson and Matt Hancock joined medical experts in delivering a desperate appeal for 20 and 30-somethings to rein in their behaviour, amid growing alarm over a surge in cases.

item.title: More than 200 migrants in 18 dinghies are intercepted in the English Channel
item.description: Dan O'Mahoney, Clandestine Channel Threat Commander, said he has been working with counterparts in France to make the journey over the English Channel 'completely unviable'.

item.title: Belarus's President Lukashenko admits 'I may have stayed in power a little too long'
item.description: Alexander Lukashenko admitted on Russian state media his 26 years of rule in Belarus may have lasted 'a little too long' the day after the country's opposition leader was allegedly snatched.

item.title: Minister admits Boris Johnson's Brexit plans will break international law
item.description: Northern Ireland Secretary Brandon Lewis today admitted Boris Johnson's plans to tear up part of the Brexit divorce deal will breach international law.

item.title: Trump 'shrugged' at Melania leaving him over infidelity, book says
item.description: Michael Cohen, Donald Trump's former personal lawyer's new book Disloyal contains details of Cohen acting as Trump's fixer.

item.title: Pain reliever used by 25% of Americans is found to alter user's perception of risk, study reveals
item.description: The pain reliever acetaminophen is a popular medication to ease headaches, but a new study finds it alters perception of risk and makes dangerous activities more appealing.

item.title: Willie Walsh keeps £6.3million IAG bonuses despite investors' fury
item.description: The International Airlines Group (IAG) revealed only 71.6 per cent of investors approved executive pay awards at its annual shareholder meeting in Madrid.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres 'ran household like military-style boot camp'
item.description: A former staffer for Ellen DeGeneres told DailyMail.com: 'Ellen was the worst person that I've ever met in my life. She takes pleasure in firing people... She treated you like you were nothing.'

item.title: Fuming Britons blast surprise quarantine on seven Greek islands
item.description: The Greek islands of Lesvos, Tinos, Serifos, Mykonos, Crete, Santorini and Zakynthos are being stripped of quarantine exempt status as of 4am on Wednesday.

item.title: Dominatrix insists 'we were just giving people a laugh' after she and her slave are barred from pub
item.description: Dominatrix Lydia Chadwick, 30, has insisted she did not mean to cause offence after she and her 'slave' were barred from The Mill in Ulverston for a public spanking session on Sunday evening.

item.title: Mrs Hinch Maybelline Instant Age Rewind Concealer
item.description: Taking to her Instagram stories this morning, Sophie took to the camera filter-free and shared a handful of her makeup favourites as she got ready for work. And she looked flawless.

item.title: Britain's Got Talent Ofcom complaints more than DOUBLE to 2,966 after Diversity routine
item.description: The new figures come as lead dancer, choreographer and guest judge Ashley Banjo defended his group's performance, calling it 'his art'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: HMRC investigates 27,000 'high-risk' furlough claims
item.description: The Prime Minister's official spokesman said that a number of criminal investigations were under way into suspected fraud and that one arrest had already been made.

item.title: Scientists question 'highly improbable' results of Russia's Covid-19 vaccine tests
item.description: The scientists have cosigned an open letter highlighting their concerns over what they say are a series of 'highly improbable' duplications in response results from Sputnik V trials.

item.title: Apple announces September 15 virtual event where it is expected to unveil new iPhone 12
item.description: After months of waiting, Apple shared a new event on its website that could showcase the new iPhone 12. The tech giant is inviting the public to a virtual event September 15 at 10am PDT.

item.title: G4S executives are charged with defrauding Ministry of Justice
item.description: Three executives of G4S Care and Justice Services (G4SCJ), including Richard Morris, pictured, along with Mark Preston and James Jardine will stand trial next month at Southwark Crown Court.

item.title: Teachers send girl home because they thought her 'naturally thick' eyebrows were fake
item.description: Student Megan Davies was sent home from school near Liverpool within 20 minutes of arriving for the new term because her tan and eyebrows apparently looked fake. But the pupil insists they are both real.

item.title: Apple's new floating store in Singapore has underwater boardroom
item.description: Apple's first ever floating-store will open Thursday at Singapore's Marina Bay Sands. The immense dome offers 360-degree views of the skyline during the day, and glows at night.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bolton residents enjoy pints before pubs lockdown
item.description: Furious landlords in Bolton were left red faced as they were told of the new measures by drinkers after being given 'no notice' from the government.

item.title: Mother whose murdered body was found in freezer had written to Jeremy Kyle asking for help
item.description: Mihrican 'Jan' Mustafa, 38, pictured, and Henriett Szucs, 34, were both discovered dead in the padlocked unit at the east London flat of their killer, Zahid Younis.

item.title: Britain reports 30 more deaths from Covid-19 in biggest spike for six weeks
item.description: The Department of Health announced the significant hike in deaths but said it did not include Northern Ireland which is yet to report its figures.

item.title: Missing hiker, 80, feared dead, turns up at press conference
item.description: Pensioner Harry Harvey, described as a 'competent hiker', was reported missing in the Gunnerside area of Richmondshire, North Yorkshire, at around 1.30pm on Sunday.

item.title: Russian opposition group backed by Alexei Navalny is 'attacked with a chemical agent'
item.description: Two people were taken to hospital on Tuesday for tests after the masked assailants entered the offices of the Anti-Corruption Foundation in Novosibirsk, Siberia's biggest city.

item.title: Children and parents are injured as car mounts pavement outside London primary school
item.description: Emergency services are on the scene outside Beatrix Potter primary in Earlsfield, south west London. Police have confirmed that a vehicle collided with a 'number of children and two parents'.

item.title: 'Manipulative' boyfriend, 36, stabbed his ex to death after she ended their relationship
item.description: Paul Crowther claimed he was told to kill Bethany Fields, 21, by voices in his head called Chucky and Osiris. Leeds Crown Court heard Miss Fields had previously warned police about her ex-boyfriend.

item.title: Outraged residents whose street was turned into cycle lane stunned after protest signs removed
item.description: Residents signs in protest of their road in Poole, Dorset, being turned into a cycle lane have been torn down by council workers, who claim the 'screws' in the wooden signs could injure cyclists.

item.title: Ancient dog in Italy 'could be the oldest pet ever found', scientist say
item.description: Researchers from the University of Siena in Italy hope their discovery can shed light on how dogs made the change from wild carnivores to loving companions.

item.title: Could your sleeping position be the key to success? High earners favour 'the freefall'
item.description: A survey of more than 5,000 British professionals found 29 per cent of those earning more than £54,900 prefer to sleep with their arms and legs spread out - a position known as 'the freefall'.

item.title: Swan-shaped superyacht concept with detachable 'head' unveiled
item.description: This first-of-its-kind superyacht has been designed to look like a swan with a sleek 'neck' and an elegant body intended to resemble a swan's wings and feathers.

item.title: Female lingerie tycoon, 39, launches legal fight to force Garrick Club to admit women
item.description: Emily Bendell, CEO of lingerie brand Bluebella.com, is seeking an injunction preventing the Garrick Club in London from 'continuing to operate its discriminatory' policy.

item.title: Mary Kay Letourneau left her estate to ex-husband Vili Fualaau and their two daughters
item.description: Mary Kay Letourneau, the former Seattle teacher who was convicted of raping Vili Fualaau, a sixth-grade student in the 1990s before marrying him, has left her estate to him and their daughters.

item.title: Curious kitten gives manicurist a helping paw as she files model's long pointed nails
item.description: Four-month-old kitten Mau 'helped' her owner Liana Nicolae file a model's nails in Romania by grabbing hold of the file with both paws and following the forward and backward motion.

item.title: Primary teacher 'sent naked waist-down selfies to schoolboy's mother and was sacked
item.description: Married primary school teacher Clive Beattie allegedly sent naked selfies to a schoolboy's mother - and was sacked when her husband found the X-rated nude snaps, a hearing was told.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police 'did not know' of Ariana Grande concert
item.description: The role of the police and other emergency services came under the spotlight on the second day of the inquiry in Manchester (pictured: Salman Abedi at Victoria Station)

item.title: Decline in vehicle journeys in lockdown did NOT reduce emissions of toxic particles
item.description: Study by University of Stirling found that harmful particulate matter (PM2.5) emissions remained consistent during the first month of lockdown, despite a 65% fall in traffic on Scotland's roads.

item.title: Black man, 35, died after being restrained by police, inquest hears
item.description: Kevin Clarke died in police custody at Lewisham Hospital in March 2018, following an incident in the Polsted Road area of Catford, south-east London.

item.title: Priti Patel lashes out at Extinction Rebellion protesters
item.description: Speaking to the Police Superintendents' Association annual conference, Priti Patel said she would not allow the group to cause 'anarchy'.

item.title: Crosby family of Birmingham stab victim, 23, who is fighting for his life speak out
item.description: Michael Callaghan (right) was wounded when a crazed knifeman rampaged across Birmingham city centre in the early hours of Sunday. His friend Jacob Billington (left) died.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown has pushed the arts to 'point of no return' - Andrew Lloyd Webber
item.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber lamented the impact of lockdown and social distancing, saying it had made it economically 'impossible' to run theatres.

item.title: Tennyson's Lincolnshire is a glorious mix of vast countryside, open beaches and quaint little towns
item.description: Lincolnshire has long been overshadowed by its cooler neighbour Norfolk. But when Angelina Villa Clarke visited this quiet corner of England, she found that it has its own fair share of charm.

item.title: Acres of Kent's iconic shoreline White Cliffs of Dover on sale for £50,000
item.description: Acres of the iconic White Cliffs of Dover are up for sale for just £50,000 in a rare opportunity for buyers to snap up a portion of British history. The land has spectacular views across the Channel.

item.title: Donald Trump's net worth sinks $600 million to $2.5 billion on new Forbes rich list
item.description: President Donald Trump's net worth is down $600 million from last September and he's fallen 64 spots lower on the Forbes 400, the magazine reported Tuesday.

item.title: Global warming: CO2 'reduces lifespan of trees', study says
item.description: Researchers analysed tree-ring data of more than 200,000 records of 110 species across Europe, Asia and the Americas.

item.title: 'I have no desire to wipe out humans': AI writes article for The Guardian
item.description: In an Op-Ed for the newspaper, a robot called GPT-3 was tasked with convincing its human readers that robots are harmless and come in peace.

item.title: Teen Tilly Lockey,who lost her hands to meningitis will be a TV presenter for children's show
item.description: Teenager,Tilly Lockey with bionic arms who lost her hands to meningitis as a baby, will become a TV presenter for children's news show ''FYI: For Your Information'

item.title: Tedx London sparks backlash after saying it will use the term 'womxn' to be 'more inclusive'
item.description: TedX London, which organises volunteer-led TED-style talks in the capital, has faced strong criticism after it announced its autumn programme using the word 'womxn'.

item.title: Berlin's left-wing officials are ordered to remove cycle lanes installed during pandemic by court
item.description: Berlin's administrative court has ordered for the city's left-wing government to remove temporary cycle lanes installed during the pandemic after Germany's AFD party filed an urgent motion.

item.title: Mother says she could sense her daughter had cancer weeks before the ten-year-old was diagnosed
item.description: Sharon McAllister, from Rutherglen, Scotland, has spoken of her ten-year-old daughter Kaiann's heartbreaking battle with form of cancer, Acute Lymphoblastic Leukaemia.

item.title: Princess Sofia of Sweden says she'd never want to have her own 'Megxit' from the royal family
item.description: Princess Sofia of Sweden, 35, has revealed she would never want to follow in the footsteps of Meghan Markle, 39, to step back from the royal family because she has 'found such a fantastic balance'.

item.title: Philippine leader pardons US Marine in transgender killing
item.description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte on Monday decided to pardon Lance Cpl. Joseph Scott Pemberton from prison after the family of the homicide victim, Jessica Laude, blocked the move.

item.title: Caerphilly will remain in lockdown until OCTOBER at the earliest, says health chief
item.description: The high street in Caerphilly was bustling as locals rushed to grab the essentials amid fears the new restrictions could put businesses at risk. The area will go into lockdown from 6pm.

item.title: Fears grow the Black Death could spread into China as Mongolia reports new death of bubonic plague
item.description: Mongolia, bordered by China, reported that a 38-year-old man had died from the plague on Monday in the country's western Zavkhan province after eating marmot meat last month.

item.title: Julian Assange warned over outbursts from dock at extradition hearing
item.description: Judge Vanessa Baraitser, briefly adjourned proceedings at the Old Bailey after the 49-year-old interrupted the evidence of US human rights lawyer Clive Stafford Smith this morning.

item.title: Tatler reveals what the return to boarding school will really be like post-Covid
item.description: Tatler revealed the careful planning by some of the UK's most prestigious schools in welcoming well-heeled children from across the country back to their boarding houses and classrooms.

item.title: Which were the cheapest and most expensive supermarkets last month?
item.description: Aldi beat all of Britain's other major supermarkets to come in first place on pricing for the 74 products in question, followed by fellow German discounter Lidl and rival Asda, according to Which?

item.title: Donald Trump claims he has more tapes of Michael Cohen 'and other media scum reporters'
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday attacked former lawyer Michael Cohen, who referred to the president as a 'cult leader.' Trump said there were 'many more tapes' of Cohen and 'media scum.'

item.title: Christian sentenced to death in Pakistan for 'blasphemous texts' after 'refusing Islam conversion'
item.description: Asif Pervaiz, 37, has been in custody since 2013 for allegedly insulting Islam in texts to his supervisor at work and was found guilty in Lahore on Tuesday but has denied any wrongdoing.

item.title: Nudist with 'potato chip' toenail has foot fungus burnt off In My Feet Are Killing Me
item.description: Robert Shearn III, from New Jersey, has his 'potato chip-resembling' toenail removed and his foul foot fungus burnt off in tonight's episode of Quest Red's, My Feet Are Killing Me!

item.title: Three more images unveiled to be displayed in Kate Middleton's Hold Still exhibition
item.description: The gallery unveiled three more images selected by the Duchess of Cambridge, 38, for the Hold Still exhibition, after she invited the public to submit images taken in lockdown for the project.

item.title: Omid Scobie is 'grateful' that Finding Freedom is still 'riding high' as a bestseller
item.description: Omid Scobie, the co-author of Finding Freedom, has taken to Instagram to say he's 'grateful' it's 'riding high' on The Sunday Times bestseller list - almost one month since its release.

item.title: HMS Queen Elizabeth stays in port for second day in a row after crew tested positive for Covid-19
item.description: Royal Navy aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth has postponed sailing from Portsmouth Naval base for the second day in a row after seven crew members tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: French police make first arrest over horse mutilations
item.description: More than 150 investigations have been opened in France while specialists are looking into Satanic rituals, but detectives still have no firm leads (pictured, injured horse Cimona).

item.title: Princess Beatrice steps out for some retail therapy at The Little White Company
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 32, was seen in public today for the first time since her wedding as she visited baby shop The Little White Company in London with new husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, 36.

item.title: Black bear enjoys a dip in a Pennsylvania koi pond and even plays with the plastic ducks
item.description: A black bear faces off against a team of plastic ducks after wandering into a koi pond. Hilarious footage filmed in Jim Thorpe, Pennsylvania, shows the bear cooling off from the heat.

item.title: Resourceful couple create a DIY walk-in wardrobe in their spare bedroom for less than £370
item.description: Hari Harris, 25, a father-of-one and retail manager from Shropshire, had a spare room in his home that he was keen to turn into a space for his clothes.

item.title: Lord Alan Sugar slams 'complacent' Britons working from home
item.description: Lord Sugar - speaking from Beckenham - said his 'businesses have all come back' and others should too. His comments come amid the Government's push to convince Britons to return to their desks.

item.title: High blood pressure and diabetes 'can impair thinking and memory'
item.description: Scientists at the University of Oxford found that those suffering from the diseases had 'significant structural changes' in the brain's grey and white matter. The study was published in Nature Communications.

item.title: Covid-19 hospitalisations in Europe still only a fraction of what they were at the pandemic's peak
item.description: Countries such as France , Spain and Belgium, which are now seeing hospital patient numbers rise again, are recording far fewer admissions than at the peak of the pandemic.

item.title: Meet Julian Assange's Australian lawyer Jennifer Robinson
item.description: As one of the country's leading human rights lawyers, Jennifer Robinson has represented Amber Heard and Julian Assange and counts Amal Clooney among her inner circle of friends.

item.title: New law will give families of police officers like PC Andrew Harper legally guaranteed support
item.description: UK Home Secretary Priti Patel is expected to speak of her disdain for those who 'laugh in the face of the law' at a meeting with top officers today.

item.title: Katie Holmes' new boyfriend is the 33-year-old son of an iconic New York restaurateur
item.description: Emilio Vitolo Jr., Katie Holmes' new flame is a restaurateur and native New Yorker who, despite his more humble upbringing, is no stranger to the world of celebrities.

item.title: The Rolling Stones' flagship store on London's iconic Carnaby Street opens its doors tomorrow
item.description: The RS No.9 Carnaby store is located in the London's iconic Carnaby Street - synonymous with the swinging 60s culture, which the band were at the forefront of.

item.title: China and India 'both fire shots' along disputed border
item.description: Indian soldiers responded with warning shots after China's forces gathered menacingly with 'rods, spears and sharp weapons' on the disputed border between the nuclear-armed rivals.

item.title: Chinese city trials to monitor and rate residents' behaviour through a smartphone app
item.description: Officials in Suzhou, east China, introduced the rating system, loosely translated as the 'Civility Code', to encourage people to become the model citizens in the eye of the government.

item.title: Teachers say 'unfit' Covid testing is hitting school reopenings
item.description: A Birmingham teacher said she and her son missed school because they were unable to get a home test, and had to drive to either Oldham or Romford for one.

item.title: Drivers are most likely to speed on roads with 30mph limits, says DfT
item.description: Analysis found that 54% of cars were driven too fast on 30mph roads during free-flow conditions last year. This is compared with 50% on motorways and just 9% on 60mph routes, says the DfT.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths hit 24-week low of 73 in final week of August, official data shows
item.description: The dip marks a 24 per cent drop on last week's 96 deaths, which were the first time coronavirus deaths had fallen into double-digits. It is a nose-dive from 8,000-a-week at height of pandemic.

item.title: Disney's Mulan faces fresh boycott calls after filming scenes in China's Xinjiang
item.description: The latest furore exploded when views spotted that Disney included 'special thanks' to Xinjiang government in the credits after the movie began showing on the Disney+ channel last week.
item.media:description: A billboard for Disney's "Mulan" film is seen outside a shopping mall in Bangkok, where calls for a boycott of the movie are growing

item.title: Lewis Hamilton is mocked for saying he'll cut his carbon footprint with new £80,000 Mercedes
item.description: Six-time world champion Hamilton bragged he is doing his bit to help the environment, despite driving gas-guzzling F1 cars and jetting around the world.

item.title: Thugs beat husband, 23, to death in front of wife after he intervened when they racially abused her
item.description: Amaan Momand, 23, (pictured) was 'literally beaten to death,' in Birmingham last September, moments after his wife was called a 'p*** c***,' a murder trial has heard.

item.title: Mafia boss EATS prison guard's finger after attacking him during cell inspection
item.description: Guiseppe Fanara, 60, who was serving a life sentence at Rome's Rebibbia prison, allegedly attacked seven guards in June when they came to inspect his cell, biting on of their fingers off and swallowing it.

item.title: Designer clothes, shoes and handbags could be made from MUSHROOMS
item.description: Researchers from the University of Vienna, Austria have created a leather-like material from pressed and chemically processed mushrooms.

item.title: Husband who murdered his wife released from prison as parole board rule he is not risk to public
item.description: Russell Causley was jailed for life for killing Carole Packman in 1985. The crime occurred a year after he moved his lover into their home in Bournemouth, Dorset.

item.title: Britain's first geothermal lido opens in Cornwall - and the water is a toasty 35C
item.description: The geothermal pool is a new feature of the Jubilee Pool in Penzance, which has undergone a £1.8million upgrade. It is hoped that the geothermal pool can remain open all-year around.

item.title: WhatsApp bug is forcing users to delete and reinstall the app
item.description: The bug, detailed by independent WhastApp experts WABetaInfo, was causing users to lose their entire chat history permanently if they hadn't done a recent backup.

item.title: How rural areas can get faster broadband
item.description: The Gigabit Broadband Voucher Scheme was launched with the aim of increasing coverage across the UK, especially in the countryside.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are 'relieved and pleased' to pay off Frogmore Cottage renovations
item.description: The Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 39, are 'relieved and pleased' to pay off the Frogmore Cottage renovations, a source told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl.

item.title: Zaghari-Ratcliffe faces 'a new charge' in Iran where she was freed from prison due to Covid-19
item.description: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, 42, was released from prison because of the coronavirus pandemic after serving nearly all of her five-year sentence, after she was arrested in Iran in 2016.

item.title: Swimmer is mauled to death by a shark at a NETTED beach in Australia
item.description: The horrific incident unfolded just metres away from other surfers at Greenmount Beach just after 5pm, when the 46-year-old man was bitten on the leg.

item.title: Archaeology: Egyptian experts unearth 13 sealed wooden coffins in the desert necropolis of Saqqara
item.description: Located 19 miles south of Cairo, the vast burial complex - which features the step pyramid of Djoser and flat-roofed tombs - served the ancient capital of Memphis.
item.media:credit: Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities

item.title: Farm fire kills up to 2,000 pigs in front of 'devastated' farmer
item.description: Up to 2,000 pigs were killed in a fire on a farm in Kilkeel, County Down, Northern Ireland. Firefighters were called to the blaze in Kilkeel, County Down, shortly before 9pm on Monday.

item.title: Former home to tailoring business that made jackets for Stella McCartney for sale
item.description: The building in Manchester is being sold at auction via estate agents SDL Auctions, with a guide price of £165,000.

item.title: China has given experimental COVID-19 vaccines to 'hundreds of thousands without a single infection'
item.description: The two vaccine candidates developed by China National Biotec Group (CNBG) can also protect people from the coronavirus for as long as three years, said an official from the company.

item.title: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden shares a loved up photo with her husband
item.description: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden, 43, beamed in a series of photos taken with Prince Daniel, 46, as they journeyed between the mountains of Storulvån, Sylarna and Blåhammaren.

item.title: Prince William pays tribute to air ambulance community in moving open letter
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 38, who flew as a medic for two years with the East Anglian Air Ambulance until 2017, praised the 'wonderful' spirit of the community in the moving open letter.

item.title: Students 'kissed without consent' in acting classes at leading drama school
item.description: Sydney Feder and Alyse McCamish, (pictured) both 23, are pursuing legal action against The Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama (pictured).

item.title: NHS testing boss issues 'heartfelt apology' to people unable to get Covid tests
item.description: Director of testing Sarah-Jane Marsh said there is capacity at testing sites but laboratories processing the tests are at a 'critical pinch-point'. Ms Marsh added that the system is doing 'all it can to expand quickly'.

item.title: US Army spent millions developing Star Wars-like walking robots
item.description: The project to create a fleet of real life AT-AT walkers from Star Wars started in 1981 at Ohio State University as the US military searched for novel ways to traverse rough terrain.

item.title: Are we heading for an Indian Summer? Britain will enjoy 75F temperatures this week
item.description: Temperatures in Britain are expected to stay in the mid-70s this week - before potentially rising into the 80s after the weekend.

item.title: Meet the 'Naked Rancher' who herds cattle, chops wood and goes fishing in the buff
item.description: Dick Powers, 36, from Montana, spends his days herding cattle, chopping wood and fishing on his family's 1,800 plot. He explained being naked 'frees his spirits'.

item.title: Astronomers find NO technological signs of alien life in study of more than 10 MILLION star systems
item.description: Perth-based researchers used the Murchison Widefield Array (MWA) radio telescope in the Western Australian outback.

item.title: Teen rapist is jailed for more than eight years after his pregnant victim turned him in
item.description: A vile 17-year-old who raped and robbed a pregnant woman in Feltham while threatening her with a screwdriver has been jailed for eight-and-a-half years at Isleworth Crown Court.

item.title: Lloyds forced 30,000 company owners to open fee-paying business accounts to get Bounce Back Loans
item.description: Lloyds Bank forced 30,000 small company owners to open fee-paying accounts in order to access the Government's Bounce Back Loan Scheme, which was set up to help those impacted by coronavirus.

item.title: BBC Europe editor Katya Adler is found to have breached impartiality guidelines
item.description: BBC Europe editor Katya Adler took to Twitter to slam comments by Cabinet Office Minister Michael Gove in April and has now been found to have breached impartiality guidelines.

item.title: Earthquake measuring 3.9 on Richter scale hits southern England
item.description: Locals in Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire all reported feeling the tremors - with one saying they 'felt their whole house shake'. Some 610,000 people live in the affected area.

item.title: White Island survivor shows how her horrifically burned legs have healed in three candid photographs
item.description: Stephanie Browitt suffered burns to 70 per cent of her body and had her fingers amputated in the horror eruption near Whakatane in New Zealand last December.

item.title: Icelandic girl admits she posted video that revealed meeting with Masoon Greenwood and Phil Foden
item.description: Law student Lara Clausen, 19, says she posted the video of the two young stars meeting with her and her cousin on SnapChat, because she did not realise how famous the footballers were.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Trump is right, the 1619 Project promotes fake history
item.description: To reframe the dismantling of British rule in the US as a battle to maintain slavery is disgraceful. It also, like so much of the culture war protests since George Floyd was killed, plays right into Trump's hands.

item.title: GP offered to give desperately ill son half of her OWN liver to save him because of donor shortage
item.description: Dr Nighat Arif, from Buckinghamshire, urged members of the BAME community to register as donors, saying her son's life was saved after he received the liver of a boy who'd tragically died.

item.title: Family discover rare 'alien-like' sea creatures 'worth £50,000' washed up on a UK beach
item.description: Martyn Green, 47, and his family discovered a piece of driftwood covered in 'alien-like' creatures while holidaying in Caernarfon, Wales. After a Google search they found the true value of their find.

item.title: Rising Covid-19 cases are headed by a three-fold rise in infections in people in teens and 20s
item.description: Data from Public Health England shows that coronavirus cases among people in their teens and 20s have more than tripled since pubs and restaurants reopened on July 4, 'Super Saturday'.

item.title: Bank of England's chief economist warns against extending furlough scheme
item.description: Andy Haldane, chief economist at the Bank of England, says the pandemic has caused 'lasting structural damage' to the economy and that 'regrettably, some business will not make it'.

item.title: Merseyside beauty salon is slammed after putting up poster denying coronavirus exists
item.description: Skin Kerr Aesthetics, Hair and Beauty, in Bootle, Merseyside, shared the notice (pictured) on its Facebook page, which has since been deleted.

item.title: Mother who thought she had a tummy ache woke up paralysed
item.description: Emese Illes-Toth, 44, from Hemel Hempstead, was devastated when she woke up after suffering a stomach ache to discover she was paralysed, with a rare condition called transverse myelitis.

item.title: Golden retriever Luna meets her family's new eight-week-old spaniel for the first time
item.description: Golden retriever Luna could not contain her excitement when her owner Miranda Bailey, 24, from Melbourne, Australia, brought home the eight-week-old cocker spaniel puppy Douglas.

item.title: THAT'S a water cooler moment! Kitten is rescued after getting stuck in a plastic bottle
item.description: A stray kitten was found with its head sticking out of the top of a water dispenser bottle (pictured). A concerned local took the cat to the local fire department in Jakarta, Indonesia to be rescued.

item.title: The Magpie Whisperer says the birds aren't just after your scalp
item.description: A bird-lover known as the Magpie Whisperer has created a special bond with the animals and is able to walk with them, play with them and build swing sets for them

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon risks fresh work from home row with Boris Johnson
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon risked a fresh row with Boris Johnson today after she said the Scottish government is 'not encouraging people to rush back to the office'.

item.title: Former Buckingham Palace butler, 63, lands two job interviews by handing out CVs at railway station
item.description: Six months after losing his job as a restaurant manager, Trevor Walford, 63, headed out to Leeds station last Tuesday armed with a sign and hundreds of CVs in a desperate bid to bag a new job.

item.title: Two sunbed addict sisters, 19 and 24, issue a warning after both being diagnosed with skin cancer
item.description: Mother-of-two Sarah Burnside, 24, and her sister Rhianne Smith, 19, from Darlington, County Durham, had cancerous moles removed from their bodies after regularly visiting sunbeds.

item.title: Adorable moment an orphaned elephant gives two dogs a ride on her back
item.description: The six-year-old elephant named Valentine kneels down on the ground and allows her two canine friends, Hiccup and Maa, to sit on her back at the Tiemchan Elephant Camp in Chiang Mai, Thailand.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: All pretence is gone, Harry and Meghan have no Royal future
item.description: RICHARD KAY: A source close to the couple confirmed they were no longer receiving financial support from Harry's father, the Prince of Wales.

item.title: Woman who'd 'given up on dating' says lockdown led her to love
item.description: After deciding on the spur of the moment to stay with casual boyfriend Ed for a week during lockdown, Gabriella, from Devon, told the Lorraine show their love has since dramatically blossomed.

item.title: There are 2.5 million clocked cars and vans on UK roads
item.description: Rapid Car Check reviewed 7m vehicles and their mileage against MOT records and found that 6.3% had discrepancies. With almost 40m motors on the road, it means 2.4m could be clocked.

item.title: Supernanny Jo Frost slams 'invasive' mother for installing CCTV cameras to spy on her children
item.description: In last night's episode of E4's Supernanny USA, Jo Frost was shocked to discover parents Crystal Tobeck and Jeff Lawrence, from Washington, has installed surveillance cameras around the house

item.title: Slovakian huntress, 31, who claims welfare of animals is top priority is attacked by trolls
item.description: Forest engineer Petra Krchavá, 31, from Vinica, Slovakia, has been hunting for more than 13 years and the passion goes back several generations in her family.

item.title: Pictured: Schoolgirl, 16, fighting for life after taking Ecstasy as family warn of drug dangers
item.description: Remy Turner, 16, was rushed to hospital in Guernsey and placed in a coma for six days after taking MDMA. The teenager's family say they were told three times that she would not survive.

item.title: Zzzzz-zoomies! Santana the bouncy whippet keeps her owner awake with laps around the bedroom at 1AM
item.description: Santana the whippet runs around her owner's bedroom in Melbourne and leaps across the bed in a crazy 'zoomies' episode in the early hours. The footage, filmed on August 21, was recently shared.

item.title: BBC Breakfast host Naga Munchetty caught moonlighting for the SECOND time
item.description: The BBC Breakfast presenter, who earns up to £195,000 per year, hosted webinars for the banking giant just one month after appearing in a paid corporate video for car maker Aston Martin.

item.title: Parents are furious after students are sent home from school for incorrect uniform
item.description: Angry parents slam headteacher as she sends home 'up to 70 children' for incorrect school uniform such as 'unpolishable' shoe and missing blazers

item.title: Four boys aged ten to 13 'gang rape four-year-old girl' in South Africa
item.description: The boys are being held at a youth detention centre and are expected to appear in court soon over the alleged gang-rape in Muldersdrift, near Johannesburg (stock photo).

item.title: Sydney father who shook baby so violently he was left with permanent disabilities is jailed
item.description: The unnamed 'inexperienced' father (pictured) appeared at Penrith District Court on Tuesday, alongside the child's mother, when he was found guilty of the life-altering incident.

item.title: Tess Daly announces she's QUITTING Children In Need after 11 years as host
item.description: The Strictly Come Dancing presenter, 51, took to Instagram to share the sad news with fans, as the charity celebrates its 40th Anniversary in November.

item.title: Shocking moment Deliveroo drivers brawl in street with two men armed with plank of wood
item.description: The delivery drivers united against two men who were armed with a plank of wood in Battersea, London.

item.title: Coronavirus-infected female surfer dragged away from Spanish beach by hazmat-wearing officials
item.description: The unnamed woman had been working on the San Sebastian beach in Spain as a lifeguard when her colleagues informed the police she was surfing while infected with coronavirus.

item.title: Bizarre 'road war' erupts as Transit van and BMW drivers try to ram each other out of the way
item.description: Smoke from the vehicles' tyres and exhausts was sent billowing into the air as the two drivers went bumper to bumper on a narrow residential street in Dunkinfield, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Chocolate digestive is crowned the UK's best-loved biscuit
item.description: Chocolate Digestives has been named the nation's favourite biscuit in a new poll. Some 2,000 Britons responded to the survey and declared the McVitie's classic their favourite biccie.

item.title: Organ musical piece intended to last 639 YEARS sees its first chord change in seven years
item.description: The performance of the Organ²/ASLSP (As Slow As Possible) composition began in September 2001 at the St Burchardi Church in Halberstadt and is supposed to end in 2640, if all goes well.
item.media:description: Organist Julian Lembke, center, changes a pipe of the organ of the John Cage organ project during a 'chord change' at the partially ruined Burchardi Church in Halberstadt, Germany, Saturday, Sept. 5, 2020. The performance of the "ORGAN/ASLSP," or As Slow As Possible, composition by John Cage began in September 2001 at the church in the eastern town of Halberstadt and is supposed to end in 2640. The last chord change was in 2013. (AP Photo/Markus Schreiber)

item.title: Novak Djokovic tells trolls to stop sick threats at US Open line judge
item.description: Novak Djokovic was disqualified despite pleading his case to officials and in the hours that followed line judge Laura Clark was the target of abuse on her personal social media profiles.

item.title: Mother shares her school lunch idea with fruits and pancakes but is slammed by other parents
item.description: Christa Spafford, from Lancashire, was slammed on Facebook by other parents after sharing her packed lunch idea for kids, which included fruits, pancakes, Nutella and honey.

item.title: Twitter comes under fire for not taking down 'deceptively edited' video of Trump
item.description: Twitter has come under fire for allowing a 'deceptively edited' video that made Donald Trump look 'disoriented' before the president walked toward Marine One on the White House lawn.

item.title: 'Duped' ex-PR for Extinction Rebellion quit... to fight for the nuclear industry, writes GUY ADAMS
item.description: GUY ADAMS: One of the great 'car-crash' TV interviews of our age occurred in Andrew Neil's BBC studio around lunchtime on October 9, last year.

item.title: Prince Hisahito of Japan takes pictures with his dad Crown Prince Akishino for his birthday
item.description: The imperial family of Japan shared snaps of Prince Hisahito with his father Crown Prince Akishino to mark his 14th birthday. The pair were seen taking photos in the garden of Tokyo home.

item.title: Holocaust survivor tells how a daring nun helped hide 83 Jewish children from the Nazis during WW2
item.description: Hélène Bach told the BBC how she was hidden and kept safe in Occupied France during WWII by the bravery of Sister Denise Bergon, who hid 83 Jewish children in her convent near Toulouse during war.

item.title: True scale of Britain's jobs bloodbath revealed
item.description: Businesses across the UK planned more than 300,000 redundancies in June and July as coronavirus wreaked havoc on the economy, new figures have revealed today.

item.title: Can YOU tell the £50 wedding dress from the one that costs £5,000?
item.description: FEMAIL has searched high street stores, online retailers and big-name designers to find some of the very best wedding ensembles on offer to British brides-to-be.

item.title: 'Jamsu' is the latest Korean beauty trend where women are dunking their made up faces in water
item.description: Women are now submerging their faces in water after they have applied their makeup, in a Korean technique known as 'jamsu' - which promises a flawless, lasting look.

item.title: Mother shares her VERY simple solution that leaves grimy bathroom tiles impossibly shiny in minutes
item.description: When mum-of-two Carey Barling moved into her new rental in southeast Queensland, the bathroom floor was filthy - so she transformed the tiles with water, sugar soap and dishwashing liquid.

item.title: Ever wondered who inspired James Bond's bizarre gadgets? New book reveals genius who was REAL 'Q'
item.description: Christopher Clayton Hutton or 'Clutty' (pictured left) was the genius inventor behind gadgets that helped British and Allied troops escape during the war.
